events.title: Alberta Invokes Notwithstanding Clause in Bill 2 to End Teachers Strike
events.description: The Alberta government passed Bill 2 (Back to School Act) using the notwithstanding clause to override Charter protections and legislate teachers back to work. The bill imposes a four-year contract on 51,000 striking teachers and restricts the ability to take future strike action.

analysis.patterns: Major Alberta Teachers Association protest • National constitutional debate over Section 33 usage

charterRights.justification: Government invoked notwithstanding clause to override freedom of association rights

events.title: Recall Act Amended: Threshold Lowered from 40% to 25%
events.description: The UCP government amended Alberta’s Recall Act to lower the petition threshold from 40% to 25% of eligible voters needed to trigger an MLA recall vote. Allows recall petitions as soon as one year after an election, rather than 18 months.

analysis.patterns: First recall petitions filed within weeks under new threshold • Concerns raised by MLAs about political stability
